metadata.titel_preek: The Things That Do Not Exist

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God creates a new humanity and brings life out of death through His Word, independent of human potential or cooperation.

tekstueel_bewijs: God who gives life to the dead
calls into existence the things that do not exist
God spoke; and it was so

object.identificatie: New Creation / New Humanity / Life out of Death
tekstueel_bewijs: a new creation, with a new humanity as its crown and glory
righteousness where there is no human capacity for it
the presence and power of the God who raises the dead
Abraham is the father of us all
reckoned it to him as righteousness
the Word that comes into the world incarnate as Jesus Christ
through the accomplished Resurrection of Jesus Christ
Death is the great nothing, the ultimate negation
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Death is described as the 'ultimate negation' and 'fell sergeant' that humans cannot overcome via 'biostasis' or effort.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Believers live as 'signs' or 'pointers' to the coming new creation in the midst of the old world.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (e.g., Sophie Scholl, von Moltke)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Being a 'sign' or 'pointer' to God's power
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Human action does not 'bring in' the kingdom; it merely points to the God who does.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God gives life to the dead
God creates something out of nothing
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We cannot bring life out of death
Ordinary men murdered seventy thousand people

voorbeelden: we who are biblical people need to remind ourselves
We want to reserve some of the credit for ourselves
God is able to raise the dead

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a polemic against human 'pouvoir' (potential) in favor of divine 'pouvoir' (sovereign grace).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Death/Exile) through the negation of ~S1 (Failure of human potential) to S1 (God's creative Word).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found solely in the 'Logos' who speaks life into the void.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; death is treated as an absolute ontological barrier.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon systematically deconstructs human agency ('no human potential') to establish God as the sole Actant of salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential for Exemplarism in Sophie Scholl
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Our lives as Christians are signs, pointers

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God who gives life to the dead
righteousness where there is no human capacity for it

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Used negatively to show that even 'good' deeds don't save, and positively only as 'signs' of God's work.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Abraham (as a model of impotence, not strength)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Abraham is the receiver of a 'reckoned' righteousness, not a hero of faith-performance.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of self-improvement; awe at divine power.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification (God works in us as signs).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Perfectly integrated; the secondary program (ethics) is strictly subordinated to the primary (soteriology).
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'angry man's' pragmatism and the 'wasteful' sign of martyrdom.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God reckoned, 'worded,' spoke him into righteousness.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Word (Christ) is the primary agent of competence.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative structure.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; the context of 'declining church' requires this specific imbalance.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Pelagian trap' by defining faith not as a human work, but as a result of God's creative 'reckoning'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric might focus on the emotional power of the Sophie Scholl story, Greimas shows that Scholl is not the 'Subject' of the sermon's engine, but a 'Sign' (Object/Helper) of the true Subject (God).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond explaining Romans 4 to showing how the 'grammar' of the text dictates a specific view of human inability.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'angry man' in the movie theater is the 'Opponent' not just to the students, but to the logic of Grace itself.

appendices.notities: Sermon delivered by Fleming Rutledge; embodies her 'Grammar of Grace' perfectly.
